channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Untaxed vehicles in the close and Number 11 selling cars privately currently 5 in the close which is number 11 an number 13 has just brought a trailer in which is blocking entrance and exit of other cars, 29th January
item.description:
Postcode is SE28 8QJ this is going to become a problem so please can you assist with someone coming around and getting this sorted as people can be very unreasonable sometimes it is Number 11 and 13 that are causing issues. Number 13 works during the day so a visit will need to be after 19:00 hrs Number 11 does not even live at the address and has parked this white trailer and another car here which both are untaxed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chart Hills Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light Not Working â€“ 5th Floor Chute Area, 29th January
item.description:
Hi, I would like to report that the light is not working at night in the chute tube area on the 5th floor of Woodsford Building, Portland Street, London. Could you please arrange for someone to replace the light as soon as possible? Thank you for your help. Kind regards,

item.title: Potholes, 29th January
item.description:
The potholes that were 'repaired' late last year are all back, and getting worse. They are at various points along this stretch of road and it is impossible to avoid them due to cars parked on either side of the road.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Congress Road, Abbey Wood

item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Yesterday road works started the whole house was vibrating, ended around 2pm.started again at 8am then stoped at 1pm. They have just turned up at 8pm after nothing since 1pm and started with the unbelievable noise. Iâ€™ve had no peace or sleep., 29th January
item.description:
There some kind of problem underground that they need to fix. 2am in the morning they finished yesterday started again at 8am stopped at 1pm and have turned up at 8pm with all the heavy noisy equipment. Theyâ€™re digging the road up now, instead of the afternoon. I canâ€™t go through another night like last night. ðŸ˜­They told me itâ€™s going to go on for around a week. I wish I could send you a video so you could understand just how load it is. My whole house is vibrating. Iâ€™m cabin crew and have to be up at 4am on Saturday morning for a 12 hour flight. If I donâ€™t sleep I canâ€™t work. I feel sick the noise is so bad.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alexandra Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
